website_summaries.verdict: All the power you'll need to clean any outdoor surface, whether it's wood, stone, cement or your car.
pros: Comes with five different nozzle tips for every kind of job
The non-kink hose is incredibly durable
cons: Expensive but cheaper than repeatedly paying a contractor to power wash for you

website_summaries.verdict: A powerful machine that can tackle almost any cleaning task; but also has been known for occasional units failing to run properly or at all.
pros: Powerful enough for heavy-duty cleaning jobs
5 quick connect nozzles and superior strength, kink-resistant hose
Compact design for easy transportation and storage
cons: On board nozzle holder rattles and may drop extra fittings when in use

customer_reviews.title: Never had a situation like this with Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Product does not work, has never worked.. Harsh winter in Idaho meant that it was not unboxed till last week. The engine is siezed. Never had a situation like this with Amazon.. and it is a Honda engine... unbelieveable.......
customer_reviews.author: Mr. E.

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service by Amazon in refunding our purchase - ...
customer_reviews.text: The product did not work as advertised out-of-the-box (new). The Honda engine did start on the first or second pull as expected (Key Buying Factor based on owning other power equipment with Honda small engines); however, after trouble shooting the unit directly with Simpson they determined that the "mixing valve" was the problem. This is a flimsy ball-and-spring check valve that is supposed to allow the cleaning fluid to be drawn up into the flow path and out the nozzle. Simpson's response was to send me an identical POS mixing valve that did not work. Great customer service by Amazon in refunding our purchase - great small engine by Honda - DO NOT BUY A SIMPSON PRESSURE WASHER.
customer_reviews.author: RGU2

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts / accessories, unusable as delivered
customer_reviews.text: Missing everything but the pressure washer itself. No gun, no wand, no hose, not even engine oil. Update 8-31: I called to get parts sent. I was told they cost more than they could sent out under warranty. When I mentioned that it's a known issue on Amazon reviews I was hung up on. Never buying a product from FNA group (the parent company of Simpson) again.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Gun broke after  about 4 hours of use
customer_reviews.text: The gun stuck in the open position and the pressure washer and will not release. This is happened after about 4 hours of use. The warranty is good for 90 days and Simpson would not replace it. They must know the sprayer gun is junk.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Great power, very poorly built.
customer_reviews.text: Great power, great features...only one problem: The engine vibrates SO badly that the entire unit spins in circles. It's VERY unstable and simply can't be left on any smooth surface like concrete or asphalt. If you don't have it on dirt (and even then it does it) you have to stop every 20 to 30 seconds to preposition it. I even resorted to chocking the wheels with bricks and it still didn't stop it. It does a fantastic job, but due to the very poor engine balancing and mounting, you'll spend far more time keeping the unit where you put it than actually washing your house. It's the absolute worst balanced engine and mounting I've ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy S. Owens

customer_reviews.title: Bad product, Great Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: We received this item quickly from Amazon and opened it within a few days to test it out. After following all the directions, my husband got it to start for 3 seconds and then it died and wouldn't restart. We were very disappointed to see we couldn't return it (will read those things more carefully in the future!), but I decided to read through the 1-star reviews and discovered that some people had complained to Amazon directly and got a refund. I immediately tried that via their customer service chat and within a few minutes had a refund to my original payment method. So pleased with Amazon, but not with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Akenson

customer_reviews.title: Major Design Flaw & NEVER tested!
customer_reviews.text: This power washer has a Magor Design Flaw! No oil or gas has been in this unit. Neither was there any smell of gasoline when I took the gas cap off. I seriously doubt than anyone tested this one or they would have known a water hose couldn't be hooked up to it. Oh! The design flaw.... You cannot hook up a water hose to it. The handle tubing, when assembled, prevents a water hose from aligning with the inlet to the water pump! I think this unit has the larger, longer engine installed on the chassis for the smaller engine. Itried to add a photo but that part of this software doesn't work!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine, but keep track of your tips.
customer_reviews.text: The pressure washer is a work horse. I pulled it out of the box, fired it up, and used it for 3 solid days. It starts first pull every time, and has plenty of power to do anything around the house -- pressure washing sidewalks, wooden decks, clean wood siding, etc. I highly recommend it based on my first full weekend putting it through the paces. I would follow the recommendation of several of the other reviewers and keep the nozzle tips in your pocket. The holder in the handle is convenient, but when the washer is working, they can rattle out. I lost my yellow tip on the first day. Huge bummer. Other than that, its a great machine.
customer_reviews.author: john chandler king

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I started pressure washer, hose exploded!! Fitting flew out and that was it, you can't put it back. It's done.
customer_reviews.author: BGD

customer_reviews.title: Starts great and runs great, once you replace the air filter
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. This replaced an old Karcher unit I'd used for over 10 years. There is a noticeable difference between 2,500 PSI and 3,200 PSI. Only reason for not five stars is the same as I found in many reviews. For some reason, during shipping, the air filter becomes soaked in oil. Until that is replaced, it will not start. I tried for 30 minutes to start and as soon as I pulled the oil soaked air filter out..........started on first pull. It's a good idea to go ahead and order a replacement air filter at the same time you order the unit. You're going to need it.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis W. Fineout

customer_reviews.title: COMMENTS ABOUT IMPROVING THE ITEM
customer_reviews.text: -IT MUST HAVE BEEN MADE FOR A MIDGET. IT WOULD HAVE BEEN GOOD TO HAVE BEEN AT LEAST 6 INCHES TALLER. NOT VERY EASY TO MOVE IT WITHOUT BENDING OVER TO MOVE THE PUMP -SECOND ITEM IS A NO BRAINER. THE ENGINE STARTED ON FIRST PULL AFTER ASSEMBLING AND PUTTING IN AS AND OIL AND CONNECTING TO WATER HOSE. THIS WAS THE MAIN ISSUE. THE CONNECTOR FOR THE WATER HOSE IS SO CLOSE TO THE RIGHT VERTICAL HANDLE THAT IT IS IMPOSSIBLE TO INSTALL A QUICK DISCONNECT WITHOUT HITTING THE VERTICAL HANLDE. WOULD HAVE BEEN MUCH EASIER TO DESIGN THE PUMP WITHOUT THE CONNECTOR ON THE PUMP BEING SO CLOSE TO THE HANDLE
customer_reviews.author: JERRY SCOTT

customer_reviews.title: Terrible pressure
customer_reviews.text: Advertised pressure of 3200 PSI is a real joke. I have another "real" washer rated the same, no comparison. Had the Simpson tested and found actual maximum output was 2700 PSI. Used only a few times. Don't go by rated psi as it's a real joke, just a marketing number that means nothing except more sales.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Murfin

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE. The main selling point for us was the dependable Honda engine on this unit. It started right up and immediately spewed gasoline continuously. Extreme fire hazard. Tried to replace via Amazon- item not eligible for return. Called Simpson- the absolute worst experience. They require brand new unit to be taken to one of their service centers for “warranty check”. Service centers charge to remove the Honda engine (not covered) to assess for warranty. Was stated we could just bring engine in but removing it from pressure washer voids warranty!!? What? I have a $400 unit that is unusable and unreturnable.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Dead on delivery
customer_reviews.text: Unpacked it, assembled easily, added gas and provided oil, connected hose and fired it up. Engine started and ran just fine, but no pressure. Tripled checked everything, waited a day and tried again. Called the toll free number that you're supposed to call before returning, and was thoroughly underwhelmed with their product support. Emailed both Simpson and their parent company, and still haven't heard anything from either a month later. So expect no support there. Called Amazon and situation was promptly resolved and credit issued.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simpson Residential power washer.
customer_reviews.text: Power washer starts easily, does a great job cleaning. However, I have to give it four stars because the first time I used it - all of the nozzles fell out of the holder and got lost in the grass and flower beds around the house. I have seen this complaint before and they have not done anything to improve the design. I would still purchase the unit but will keep tips in a safe place until time to change them. Vibration is enough to allow them to fall out.
customer_reviews.author: MSU71

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in May, 2017. So far it has performed almost flawlessly. Did several major jobs including pavers, decks, picnic tables, concrete, a large pole barn, aluminum trim and many other smaller jobs. Great tip and hose storage. Like the removable handle for transporting in the back of my pickup and able to close the box cover completely. Complaint about restarting it after refueling and sometimes just dying out while spraying. The fix was to let it sit and cool off, did restart and ran normal after that. Happened about 5 times over two years of use. Power washer has plenty of power, nice placement of the pump and exhaust.
customer_reviews.author: Crate78

customer_reviews.title: Junk - Plastic pump housing
customer_reviews.text: Update: since I dropped the pump off to the mechanic while it was cold, they said it probably froze so wont cover the warranty. While I was talking to the mechanic, he went on to tell me this is power washer is the most frequent piece of equipment they work on due to all the issues. DO NOT BUY SIMPSON 4 months after using the plastic pump housing has broke and leaks water. Called the warranty department and will drop some off next week. I will update on how well the company takes cares of these problems after going through this fix. Pumps should not crack or break like within months of purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Not so easy pull start
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup but extremely hard to start. I followed all instructions and put new oil and gas where they're supposed to go and the pull start is very hard to pull. I am 6'1" and a fit 240lbs... I'm very strong and I have the toughest time starting this thing. Almost feels like the flywheel is locking up.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Keep a leash nearby!
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving it 2 stars because it's a Honda engine. Started right up 2nd pull from box. The problem I'm experiencing is that the pressure washer seems to "walk away" while using it. I was on a level concrete patio using it and it immediately starts vibrating so much that the entire pressure washer literally starting turning around. After 5 minutes, it had moved 90 degrees as evidenced in this picture. The dog bowl was touching the tire before I started washing and you can see where the unit ended after 5 minutes. I expect much much better for the price. Amazon wouldn't let me add a photo for some reason
customer_reviews.author: Justin Girard

customer_reviews.title: Very dissatidfied
customer_reviews.text: The first time used, after 5 minutes it started leaking from the housing. Called customer service, had my take it for repair, they would not replace. They said it would take 3 weeks, it has been 5 weeks and I still do not have it back. I guess its good that I bought the extended warrenty. Don't buy, not dependable. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until the chemical injector hose barb blew apart in pieces
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few years and it worked great. At the beginning of spring it would start up with no problems. One month ago I started it up and it was working normally for the first minute and then the hose barb for the chemical injector broke off causing a stream of water to shoot straight up into the air. My inspection revealed that the part of the barb the hose is connected to had blown off leaving only the part that is screwed into the pump. If I could find a way to unscrew that part from the pump I would be ok but I don't know what to do.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Amazon should make it right for the customer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item from Amazon at a great price and initially shipped and arrived damaged so, amazon shipped another unit and these are the photos of this unit arriving damaged. I spoke with Tommy in returns and he indicated that they would not be able to ship another one I had to accept the refund. I thought Amazon should have made it right with me the customer.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Honda and Simpson have refused to honor the warranties on this product
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this 5-31-2017, it worked for a couple if months, we didnt use it more than 5 times, it has been in the shop for repairs more than weve had it at home, Honda has refused to honor the warranty which has now run out, this is crap, not a cheap purchased, we have been treated like we dont matter not does our business matter, we are not rich people, this was a big purchase for us, we have vinyl siding on our home that we can no longer clean, we will not purchase Honda or Simpson products again and tell everyone we can about the way we have been treated, DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Pam Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Vibration.
customer_reviews.text: Got yesterday. I put it together. Pretty easy. Started right up. But damn. It’s loud not cause of the motor. It vibrates to the point sounds like the motor through a rod. I mean loud. And what it is. The Handel. Even though it has screw in bolts with plastic nobs. Had to Handel back off and wrapped tape around the receiving end of the handle. Then put handle back on. It soften the noise. But still vibrates. Problem not the motor. Problem is how it’s all put together. You have to cushion all the pc that go together. You have to allow for a running motor. You design team should know this.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald G.

customer_reviews.title: Great engine and pump, but terrible frame
customer_reviews.text: Bought May 2018. Used three times - residence only. This sprayer vibrates wildly, dancing all over. It irreparably wore our one of the two rear support feet. I had to rig a 2x2 wooden cross member to replace the support feet. Then, to stop the gyrating and dancing, I finally hung my 20 lb bench anvil on the rear of the sprayer. That stopped it from bouncing away. I will never buy another, but despite it’s worthless frame, it is easy to maintain and start, and it does a good job. Simpson should pay me for making it work.
customer_reviews.author: ABChwhite

customer_reviews.title: Works great but...
customer_reviews.text: Starts right up and runs great with more than enough pressure. Took off one star because the hose blew up the first couple of hours I used it. Not sure if it got badly kinked or had a weak spot in it. Anyway, make sure you straighten your hose! Called customer service and they are sending out a new hose without any hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Pod

customer_reviews.title: Decent job
customer_reviews.text: Word of advice. This is the minimal acceptable power for a power washer. Anything less and you are basically just using the hose to rinse stuff. More advice. Cold washing is not effective with tar or gum. If you have problems with this, a $5k to $10k hot water power washer is needed. If you have this problem, skip the do it yourself and hire someone. Very easy to assemble and use. No nonsense. Relatively compact. Does a great job on grime. Will sever your foot if you don't respect the power of the 0 angle tip. This device made short work of my poor car which had turned into a rolling ball of mud and grit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing mutiple parts. Main Handle, wand, nozzles
customer_reviews.text: Missing mutiple parts from package. Main handle, spray wand, knobs, all nozzles. I recieved the engine, wheels, hose, and trigger(without a wand). Nothing else. Completely unusable ***update*** Amazon shipped again, this time I received a complete pressure washer, and it works great! So far its the best pressure washer I have ecer used. Honda engine one pull start is awesome. So Amazon customer service was great, I think the missing parts was the sellers fault, but Amazon made it right!
customer_reviews.author: Heath T.

customer_reviews.title: Batting .500
customer_reviews.text: This is the first gas pressure washer I have purchased. First one was delivered quickly but was a total dud. I followed all the directions exactly, engine fired right up, but the pump didn’t deliver any pressure. To amazon’s credit, a replacement was delivered in three days. They didn’t even want the defective one back. Day 1 with the replacement: it works, but doesn’t start up easily. Also as some other reviews state, it dances all over the place due to engine vibration. In the end it gets the job done pretty well, but I’m not sure I would encourage a friend to buy this model after my experience.
customer_reviews.author: G man

customer_reviews.title: Really Glad I Went With This One!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a month reviewing pressure washers after my Homelite/Subaru bit the dust. This unit arrived quickly. It was packaged nicely and came with engine oil. It started on the 3rd pull right out of the gate. It now starts on the first pull. As for power, this thing is extremely powerful. I did purchase separately a 33 inch wand extension so that it would work easier with a surface cleaner. The PSI difference from by old 27 PSI and this one is night and day. I don't think you can go wrong with this Simpson pressure washer.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Product did not work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I received the pressure washer .Followed all the directions. Put the oil in. Used the treated gas, I just cannot get washer to turn over. I DID ALL THE TROUBLE SHOOTING AND NOTHING. HAD MY LANDSCAPER COME OVER AND HE COULD NOT GET IT STARTED EITHER.SO ANNOYING NOW I NEED TO BUY ANOTHER WASHER AND RETURN THIS ONE.ITS DEFECTIVE...
customer_reviews.author: James D. Breedlove

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Very difficult to start out of the box. Yes I followed all the instructions. By the third time I went to use it, probably at about month 3 of owning it, it would not start period. Gas and oil levels were correct, followed the proper procedure that manufacturer recommends. Past return date for Amazon Lemon. Don’t waste your money for the chance of getting a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah J

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this pressure washer. Have used it a dozen times now and it starts up on the first pull every time (typical for Honda). Used to prep my house for paint, clean sidewalks and house exterior. Highly recommend Simpson! Have had other makes in the past at a similar cost point and this one is by far the best.
customer_reviews.author: JDG11293

customer_reviews.title: VERY short and difficult to move
customer_reviews.text: Great item, just wanted to give a heads up that it is super short and very difficult to move. I am 5'4" and it is actually too short for me to move around. My husband purchased this (he is 6 foot) and he has a really hard time bending down to move it. Overall it works great, but we both hate moving it around. Also the hose always gets in the way and caught around the tires. So if you plan on using this in one place its great. Otherwise not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Bama2324

customer_reviews.title: No problems except for the bottle of engine preservative
customer_reviews.text: In fairness, the unit worked flawlessly. No problems whatsoever. But the bottle of lube you are supposed to use to run through the water channels when you are storing the unit for extended periods cannot fit the intake because the handle bar prevents it from lining up properly grrrrr....
customer_reviews.author: ko

customer_reviews.title: Sampson with honda engine
customer_reviews.text: So very straight forward right out of the box. The machine will take the whole thing of oil they give u. When u get gas, get stabil, they have it at lowes n such. Treat ur fuel to protect against ethanol blended gas absrobing water over time. Just like u would when storing a boat for a season. I unboxed it, gased it up and used it for 3 hrs staright. Went thru almost a whole gallon of gas! Deck looks new, found iut u CAN power wash out door cushions which also look clean, did the driveway and the sidewalk. Yellow for the deck and house, green for the driveway. Great product
customer_reviews.author: A. Fuchs

customer_reviews.title: Pump assembly dead with less than 30 hours of use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased May 2016, used for 2 summer cleanups around the house without a hitch. This summer, 2018, the unit would not pressure pump at all. Engine works perfectly but when I pulled the pump apart the plastic cups in the piston assembly were all melted onto the springs. I never ran the unit without water flowing to keep it cool. Seems like others have had the same problem. Without that many hours of run time this seems to be a serious weak link in the construction. Replacement pump assembly is about $135.00 on Amazon, curious to see how long this one will last. Hoping the materials used have been upgraded.. I will update future findings.
customer_reviews.author: Joe E.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of pressure
customer_reviews.text: I primarily use this for washing (actually rinsing) my vehicles. Conserves water really good, But it does also get utilized for actual 'pressure washing' of many other things. Recently pressure washed my wood deck before applying a new paint coating. Has a lot of pressure so need to use caution as to not damage the wood fibers. My old washer was 'loaned' to a sibling and not returned, this one has significantly more pressure. Having Honda power is a plus. Easy start!
customer_reviews.author: Homer Zzyzzx

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, was nice having the bag of oil supplied. Was packed real well. The only small negative was pulling it around with the handle. Had to walk on the side of it because it would hit me in the back of the foot maybe because I am quite tall. But other than that worked great right out of the box with minimum effort.
customer_reviews.author: Sage Lee

customer_reviews.title: Better than a Ryoby
customer_reviews.text: This thing was actually upgraded to 3200 psi (it was advertised as 3100 when purchased). I had a Ryoby with the same Honda engine but when the pump blew out, I decided to buy this Simpson because it is easier to move around, larger tires, etc... It does not have the: soap dispenser option though. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis DeSapinece

customer_reviews.title: Simpson MSH3125 power washer
customer_reviews.text: Item was delivered on time and the package was undamaged; however it arrived upside down on the doorstep. As soon as discovered, turned it upright and unpacked. There was a small amount of residual oil in the packaging but otherwise all seemed well. It was packaged very well and hopefully being inverted did not cause any harm. Over all it appears to be very well made with all parts and labels and instruction in the container. Have not used it as yet but if it does not perform as advertised I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Burtonman

customer_reviews.title: Starts Every pull...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this power washer to get my mother-in-law's ranch (three large stone buildings) ready to put on the market. Picked it based on online reviews and YouTube videos. No disappointment. Runs and works great!!! Couple WARNINGS: Be sure you always have the water hose attached and turned on before starting the engine. And...don't even think about putting the small (ZERO degree) tip on the wand. At 3200 PSI that thing is absolutely deadly!!
customer_reviews.author: Patrol Navigator

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer works, but engine leaks oil
customer_reviews.text: I've had he washer for several months now and used it just a few times (maybe an hour or so total engine time). Works very well. However, three stars, because the engine leaks oil, which accumulates at the base where attached to the sprayer frame. Can't tell exactly where the oil's coming from. Called Amazon and was referred to Simpson (the one year warranty). Then Simpson said it's a Honda engine issue and was given the names of local authorized dealers to investigate the problem. (I was told Honda has a two-year warranty against manufacturer's defects.) I have not yet scheduled a time to get the problem diagnosed. Should not cost me anything except my time.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: Well made, lighter and more maneuverable than expected. Universal fittings work well with other brand accessories. Tends to take some time getting up to max pressure at cold start. Have plenty of gas handy--large reservoir goes quicker than anticipated. High quality hose doesn't kink, brass fittings eliminate leaks. The whole apparatus has redundant directions labeled everywhere, great for first use buyers. Haven't tried the detergent mode but check YouTube for configuration/application. Overall a stout tool for residential home owners.
customer_reviews.author: James L

customer_reviews.title: Design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Clearly, whoever designed this never used it. Like many pressure washers the high pressure hose and the garden hose attachments are right on top of each other which makes connecting them very cumbersome. In addition, the handle gets in the way. If your hands are child sized, no problem. Also, the handle itself is way too short. At 6' tall I can barely pull the pressure washer because the handle is so low to the ground. The Honda motor is great, starts on the first pull every time. Finally, the fitting on the pressure hose is brass and it screws to an aluminum fitting on the pressure washer. It seizes. Mine is now permanently attached now because it won't unscrew.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Just go ahead a buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I procrastinated on this for a long time, and then finally I really needed to have a pressure washer. Decided to pull the trigger on this one, and it literally arrived the next morning on my doorstep. Have used it a lot already around the house, from blasting mud off the old 4x4 to easily blowing away the green/brown stains on the concrete that gets a lot of shade and moisture. Very pleased with this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Follow the instructions... it’s been an awesome pressure washer
customer_reviews.text: I love this pressure washer!! Match it with the 33” extension paired with the 15” Karcher surface cleaner. The pressure washer will clean any surface no matter how nasty. I’ve used it to clean my long driveway curb side walks and brick mailbox. It did an amazing job. YOU MUST prime the pump for at least 15-30 seconds before starting the machine. (Let the water cycle through the machine by squeezing the trigger on the wand). ALWAYS HAVE THE TRIGGER PRESSED WHEN STARTING THE MACHINE. This will insure a smooth start. Also a good idea to buy some pump saver and run it through the machine after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Vroom

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Me and my son's purchased this for my husband for Christmas, just decided to take out of box yesterday to pressure wash house, wand melted after 15 minutes gave my son a major burn on his hand and my son is grown so I did not let a kid use it, and to top it off the the soap dispenser did not work. When I pay good money for something I expect good quality, please pay attention and go to other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Problems Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit based on Amazon reviews. The PW was delivered on time and setup was simple and straight forward, but it leaks oil everywhere when in use. Called Simpson support and they referred me to a local dealer. Dealer is very difficult to get in touch with. When I did, I was told the unit would be in his shop for several weeks. Very disappointed. Should have purchased a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Klem

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality and design
customer_reviews.text: Poor design and quality: 1- The sprayer gun is made of cheap plastic and cracked after first use 2- the hose nozzle is close to the metal bar makes it hard to screw and unscrew the house without ripping off your fingers 3- if you switch off the engine after about 15 min of use you can't turn it in again, it has to cool down for at least 45min before you can restart 4- eats a lot of gas Need to sell it
customer_reviews.author: amyskal

customer_reviews.title: PUMP Broke within the first months.  WARRANTY is a JOKE
customer_reviews.text: I really had high hopes for this pressure washer after it had some favorable reviews. Like some other reviewers have noted, the pump will fail and their idea of a warranty is for me to drive it 3 hours away and see if a company can "check it out." Very disappointing, do not buy. You have been warned. Awful customer service
customer_reviews.author: Seth Houser

customer_reviews.title: Pump Blew Apart - Also saw on other reviews
customer_reviews.text: I am shopping for a new Power Washer as my Simpson pump blew apart exactly as the one mentioned. I called Customer Service and just like this, nothing they could do. I was going to try another Simpson and after reading this, will now stay away. If I was you, I would not go with Simpson or very least, this model, it will eventually crack and blow apart.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia V. Gary

customer_reviews.title: #1 rated power washer of 2017
customer_reviews.text: Out the box I filled it up with gas n oil took five minutes to set up n fired right up ran amazing , have had so many bad power washers in the past n looked at this one for months before buying , the reviews seemed not the best on AMAZON n I was hesitated , this power washer is extremely powerful n very lightweight, also saw it was rated #1 power washer of 2017
customer_reviews.author: DREW

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed in this product. Amazon won't even return or refund my money on this product and as soon as I unboxed it and hooked everything up the pump doesn't even work and customer service says they've had many complaints about this model and the pump. Not a word from Amazon and i paid $401.00 for the machine just to be embarrassed as i couldn't get it to work...engine ran just fine but a faulty pump.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Norsworthy

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: The Simpson Cleaning MSH3125 is phenomenal. It took about 15 minutes to setup maybe even faster for the mechanically incline folks. It comes with the essentials which are the pressure tips and a detergent hose. In my opinion if you purchase a surface cleaner for driveways and patios, a turbo nozzle sprayer to clean gutters and house exterior and a foam cannon for cleaning windows and car wash. This pressure washer is a must have for home owners and with those attachments recommended you’ll never have to shell out cash to pressure wash around the house. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Andre & Clarissa Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Sorry pressure washer
customer_reviews.text: Its the sorriest pressure wash made!!! Only thing going for is Honda engine.... it leaks like cow peeing on a flat Rock, the soap suction does not work... Think I keep my old 2800psi Troy built.... This is garbage... I was looking for higher psi & electric start & this piece of crap what they sent.... more wasted money to greet people..... Donot buy...... it ain't industrial or comedshial grade..... Amazon sux for selling this to Prime members....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy With Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with purchase. No regrets. Slight disappointment: have to be careful in seating nozzle tips. Have had several instances of them not being properly seated and flying off when energized. Have found them all times except one. Unfortunately, this was the black (soap) one and had to order an entirely new set to replace it. Recommendation. would have loved for this item to have a soap tank/dispenser on the item vs having to use a tube to a soap bottle. Just a suggestion not a complaint.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES R SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This is now second review I have posted on the but amazon did not post my first review. So this unit was delivered defective amazon would do nothing told me I had to contact manufacture, manufacture told me I had to bring to service center. Now here it is almost 2 months later pressure washer is still at the service center and I still don’t have a pressure washer.
customer_reviews.author: James Ponce

customer_reviews.title: If it works it may be ok
customer_reviews.text: The first item arrived with the top motor dented in. The second won’t start. Still have not actually talked to someone from amazon to fix the problem!! Purchased the larger Simpson from Lowe’s so I could actually return or replace if it dosent work.
customer_reviews.author: Byndlimitz

customer_reviews.title: Greatest delivery and unit.
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered a variety of things off of Amazon and been happy to not too happy but this particular item was absolutely magnificent professionally delivered and professionally provided us I can’t say how happy I am with this particular product if anyone is on the fence about what to do with this decision I would absolutely 1000% choose this this company is fantastic and the product is fantastic lucky to have found them along the way thank you guys from The bottom of my heart
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Broken in the Box
customer_reviews.text: I received the Simpson MSH 3125 mega shot today. Unpacking it, the gun was split open on several seams and the trigger would not function. Clearly defective. When I immediately applied to return it — surprise it is not returnable. Thanks for telling me Amazon. No customer should be unable to return clearly broken equipment out of the box. You won this time, but it won’t happen again.
customer_reviews.author: janzoo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine
customer_reviews.text: We live on well water and many power washer pumps don't work well on well water systems. This machine acts like it has a brain and if you give it a couple of minutes, it adjusts to the well water pressure and gives you constant pressure throughout the job you are doing. Other pressure washers would fluctuate in the power of the spray but this machine runs constant. It's a work horse for sure. We have over 1,200 square feet of vinyl fencing that we power wash and some of it is a picket fence and an arbor with lots of angles. My husband says it has the same power as his power washer at work (a commercial washer).
customer_reviews.author: sk8ter

customer_reviews.title: Totally satisfied!  In fact, I'm more than totally satisfied (if that's a thing)!
customer_reviews.text: Way better than I expected! I was nervous about making such a large purchase for a machine I had never even seen, but I was pleasantly surprised when this pressure washer arrived. Everything about it says "Quality!" The Honda motor has given me peace of mind I wouldn't have had with a "no name" motor, and every other aspect of the washer...from the hose to the connections to the instructions, etc, etc...rises to a comparable level. It's clear that Simpson takes quality and customer satisfaction seriously, and I am now a hard core fan! I just wish they made other things, too, because they've become a company I feel like I can trust.
customer_reviews.author: Beach Guy

customer_reviews.title: Pressure washer
customer_reviews.text: I just used it for the first time out of the box and this happened. The first 30 mins it was working great and then the pressure dropped off slightly and I noticed the pressure relief valve had water coming out of it. It continued to leak/relieve pressure until I put it away. Also when you stop pressure washing, the engine governor cocnstantly cycles the engine speed up and down for 15-20 seconds before it stabilizes. I will try it one more time, and if it continues to leak and cycle it will be going back in box for return. The other comments about the motor not running smoothly and vibrates is accurate
customer_reviews.author: Cabo

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this pressure washer .
customer_reviews.text: 1st time i used it seemed ok until the 2nd time i checked the oil and noticed gas in the crankcase oil. Called honda dealer and they said honda does not cover gas related issues and i should replace the carb on a unit with 30 minuets on it. Ordered new carb same problem only this time the relief valve was also leaking . Called honda directly left message and never received response. Dealer said bring it by in 6 months and they will look at it at my expense
customer_reviews.author: patrick mcdougal

customer_reviews.title: Durable, affordable and efficient
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for home use and I am rather impressed! Our deck and house look amazing after using this pressure washer to clean it. It has good pressure and is very efficient! This machine is high quality and very durable. It is easy to maintain and it’s size is perfect to sit in the corner of the garage during off season without taking up too much space! I’d recommend this pressure washer for anyone looking to get the job done right!
customer_reviews.author: The Ghost O

customer_reviews.title: Way worth it
customer_reviews.text: Spend the extra money. Get this one. If you shop around different sites for this one, you'll notice the price is the same everywhere, and the price never changes. There's a reason for that. Do yourself a favor and save all the maintenance drama. Also, if you live in an area with ethanol added to your gasoline (California), get the ethanol shield additive (search on amazon for it) at the same time. You'll save yourself a lot of carburetor gunk problems. You'll never buy another one. I know. I've bought about 5 cheesy washers over the last 10 years, all for about 200 bucks, all failed within a year or two.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Some good/some bad.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this MSH3125S. So far, I like most things about it. Started right up, decent power with 25 sprayer nozzle. Don’t like the short handle — you’d be bent over a long time dragging it around the block. My big problem is that I cannot get the garden hose to unscrew so I can move it. ??? I feel the connections are stripping. Still can’t get it disconnected. This is not good.
customer_reviews.author: Dian Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Broke in first use,  can't return
customer_reviews.text: Used ONE time and it broke. Broken seal allowing fluid in the oil compartment. Can't return because the first time we used it was past the return window. VERY BAD EXPERIENCE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Swansonite

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup easy to use my only issue was one of the tires fell off after about 15 seconds of use. I found it was missing a snap ring to hold that tire on. I didn't find one among the items in the box so I had to buy one to put it on. It was only a cheap 30 cent part but it would have been nice to see all the parts included especially one that holds the tire on. After I fixed it it worked well for the thirty or so minutes I used it. I'll update if there are any other issues.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Simpson
customer_reviews.text: Best p/w I have ever used! Easy start, great pressure, no problems with it at all. Handle is a little low to the ground but is not really a problem for me. It's a compact unit! The place that holds the gun could be a little better as the wand hits the tire, but still not really a problem. There again it's compact! I would recommend this machine to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Works great and starts on first pull. The only thing I am not crazy about is that it vibrates very bad. I set it on the concrete in my garage and washed the floor down. I looked behind me and it was following me due to the vibration. Lol. Tighten the oil filler cap/dipstick firmly as mine vibrated lose and started leaking oil. Don't really think there is anything wrong, just that the unit is so light that the vibration from the engine has nothing to dampen it. But it work great.
customer_reviews.author: H. L. Overton

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great pressure washer. I've had it for about 6 months always works everytime I need it around the house. A bit pricey for around the house but I wanted a quality product that would last. Pressure is a lot even the white tip will remove some paint from certain cars so beware. I'm currently looking at getting a hydo attachment to do pipe cleaning for my sewer pipe in the house I'm curious to see how well it will work. Great product for the dyi around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good compact pressure washer
customer_reviews.text: The unit starts easily and pressure washes as expected. The unit is either running wide open or is off with no adjustable throttle. The handle bar has two easy turn knobs that tighten the handle to the base that no matter how tight you get them the handle still rattles and makes a lot of noise when running. I removed the knobs and bolts and replaced with standard 5/16" bolts and tightened the crap out of them and solved the issue.
customer_reviews.author: TjW

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE OUT OF THE BOX
customer_reviews.text: upon arrival did not work started on first pull but no high water pressure , how it ever passed QC I have no idea., upon further inspection and because I needed it asap I pulled the pump and found that they forgot the KEYWAY from the pump assembly went to tractor supply picked one up , behold 2 hours later. works fine.
customer_reviews.author: GARY SICH

customer_reviews.title: Got what I paid for at bargain price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in Jan. 2020, and have only used it for my 3rd time today. As a power washer it does what is supposed to. The picture makes it look taller than what it really is. I'm 6 ft. and have to bend over to pull it into place. After 2 uses the gun didn't work anymore. Pressure is always on. I'm also afraid to disconnect the soap hose. Also the second time I used it, the threading seemed off or stripped. I'm afraid if I unscrew it it won't screw back on. The gun is an easy replacement but the house connect seems to be a product specific part connected to the main housing.
customer_reviews.author: tchrmom

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Once running, it is a dependable, hard-working tool. The design leaves much to be desired. Incredibly dumb place to hook garden hose. Awkward and difficult to work. Hose is great, but hose holder is worthless. the handle should be linger to make easier moving around. I like it, but a designer who knows what he is making could improve it to a 5 star easily.
customer_reviews.author: NT Student

customer_reviews.title: Omes with oil in the engine
customer_reviews.text: I recieved a used machine. Theres oil all over inside the box. Remove the engine oil dipstick, tilt the machine and there it is, it is filled with engine oil. It also smell gas fumes. I do not know if its supposed to be like this. The manual and signs says there should be no engine inside the machine. there is separate pack of engine oil that comes with the package.
customer_reviews.author: Waldugan

customer_reviews.title: Good Pressure Washer, Pressure loss is an issue
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid power washer. I live in Florida, and have to constantly power wash my pool deck, driveway and sidewalks. The Honda engine is easy to start, the pressure is powerful. I only have two issues with it. 1) the pressure is sometimes inconsistent, which could be my water, but more than likely it is loosing pressure through the pump. 2) it is not very maneuverable, making it difficult to do a larger area.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C. Rouse

customer_reviews.title: Worked 1.5 times....
customer_reviews.text: Used this pressure washer once on an old outdoor wooden swing and it cleaned it up nice! Second time I used it to wash my husband car and it stopped working, bolts broke off and it sprung a major leak! I had this item 5 days so I went on amazon to do a return and it said non-returnable item. I was a little freaked out so I contacted amazon, they were able to either do a replacement or a refund (refund for sure). They said to keep the item and do as I wish with it since it was a hazard to return. Glad I was able to get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy S

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this power washer two years ago, wanted to use it awhile before I wrote a review. I have used it for many cleaning jobs, washing the car, truck, semi, boat, dock, and outdoor furniture. It does a great job, and hasn’t had any mechanical problems. It is a great cleaning machine, would recommend you buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2 days and I still cannot get it started
customer_reviews.text: I followed all the directions. I called the service center for phone support. 2 days, 100's of pulls to where I am sore. Still will not start. I knew I should have bought an electric. Update on August 5, 2019 - Service center has had it for 4 weeks. They called me today saying the motor is defective and needs to be replaced and can I forward over my invoice again. And now I am out of my Amazon Return window so I am stuck with it. This is just unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: cErick

customer_reviews.title: Part missing
customer_reviews.text: Please see manual page 10 Part E. The quick Connect Spray Wand was not in the box. Please get it sent so we can use the pressure washer. The Nozzles and Gun were in the box but not the Wand.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Parker

customer_reviews.title: If loving ur power washer is wrong, I don't want to be right.
customer_reviews.text: I have used many different power washers in my day, this one is the best I have owned so far. I purchased it based on the high Amazon reviews and the because I could find a 3100 psi at this price. The Honda engine starts on two pulls and runs without any adjustments. The hose is the perfect length. The off switch is the best design I have seen yet. The size of unit is perfect and stores away in the corner of my shop. You can't go wrong with this model. Oh and buy the turbo nozzle, you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: R.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great reliable machine
customer_reviews.text: I've got three of these. Two for work and one for home. I like them because one man can easily load/unload this machine into a pickup truck. It's smaller but it is all the power washer you need for anything. I use the crap out of them. Even jetted a sewer with one. Starts every time. Even after a long winter in the shed. I swear by Honda motors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict Buffalo

customer_reviews.title: Service, Parts Cost
customer_reviews.text: This is nice and easy to use, but i imagine most of pressures are! My pump cracked the first winter i owned it. I called Simpson because I heard they would not warranty it, just to buy a new pump. The rep priced me the pump at 315.00. On line the average pump cost was around 120. Customer service is very important to me! I didn't ask them to warranty it, I was going to replace it my self. They could of treated me like they cared a little and i may of purchased their products in the future. Now i don't plant to buy from them again!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy D.

customer_reviews.title: Love this pressure washer!
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a great pressure washer! I've cleaned two patios, one deck, and my front walk way (which was almost black. My walk way and one patio look like freshly poured concrete, that's how clean they are. I used Simple Green for my cleaning solvent and was very satisfied with the results when used in conjunction with my Simpson pressure washer. This is a great machine, however it could be better with the following changes: Should have a built in solvent container, and the pull handle on the starter should be repositioned to make it easier to grab onto.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, easy to start, fuel efficient
customer_reviews.text: Easy starting (usually first pull), doesn't take up too much storage space, powerful and a monster when cleaning concrete or brick. I'm glad I also purchased an adjustable flow device for the wand to reduce the power for other surfaces This is a very strong machine which must be considerably reduced when power washing wood like cedar or woven deck chairs. In combination with the 16" surface cleaner, this made very short work for cleaning driveways and sidewalks.
customer_reviews.author: mwtravlr

customer_reviews.title: It's a great tool and at a great price point
customer_reviews.text: I used it on my screened in patio (wood), patio furniture, and the brick siding on my house. You just have to be careful because it is very powerful and will chip your paint or remove your grout. Just pay attention to the nozzle guide as well as your spray distance. Also, you may want to wear hearing protection, it's very loud. I will be using it on my front patio, walkways, and on more of my brick siding, as well as washing my truck and wife's SUV. It's a great tool and at a great price point. Home Depot had the same price, they just could not get it go me as fast as Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Probably best value on market
customer_reviews.text: Came well packaged box was on undamaged. Assembly straightforward and simply. Started on second pull. Appears to be crazy powerful. It’s replacing a 2000 psi Ryobi electric and my initial impression is this blows away the Ryobi power wise. Very happy thus far. Coming with a Honda engine plus reading several positive reviews are what led me to select this product.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Burger

customer_reviews.title: Great power washer
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a number of power washers. This one has the power! I had a problem when it first arrived and once again Amazon made it right in short order. My main reason for shopping Amazon. I cleaned concrete, washed the house, removing green stuff from the North side siding with zero problems. Then removed paint from a deck. (Note to self, never use the #1 on wood again) I can not recommend enough! Great washer great price!
customer_reviews.author: W4JLE

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I've used it for a several hours now ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've used it for a several hours now and I'm still very happy with it. I did have to replace the air filter when I first got it, the original one was full of oil. If you can't get it to start remove the air filter and try again. That's how I found out it was soaked in oil. Also when it's hot if it doesn't start right away make sure you release the pressure on the hose. Every time you pull you are building pressure in the hose, which makes it harder for the engine to start. I also put all the nozzles in my pocket. They tend to vibrate out of the holders.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Pump failed year 3
customer_reviews.text: Used minimally in 3 years. Always garage kept. Engine is still good. Spent $85 to try and fix pump. Mechanic couldn’t get pressure back up. He recommended New pump. $130. $300 to get it back in working condition. Small air tires are annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Jaycee

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: I install quick disconnects on the in and out bibs...and it's easy to hook everything up and get to work with it. The engine starts easily and everything runs well. I've had it a month (used about four times) and I haven't seen any leaks from water or oil. It appears to be built well. I love it...lots of pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Talker

customer_reviews.title: Not “easy start” engine. I would settle for it just to start.
customer_reviews.text: To say this is “easy start” is an over statement. It worked fine the first time but I could not get it to start for the next job. I had to go back to my electric washer. I will try to fix it but I’m not confident I will keep it after the trouble this caused. UPDATE: I’m still not able to get it started and all Simpson did was give me the number of a local Honda shop. This is only a year old and it only worked one time! What a big pain in the butt! The Honda shop doesn’t answer their phone or return my message. So frustrating for such a big purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Buening

customer_reviews.title: workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box this power washer impresses. It is compact and easy to assemble. One suggestion in the directions is to be more specific where the oil drain plug is located. It is a general manual for several models and inaccurate for my model. It started up immediately and ran like a champ for the six hours of my fence cleaning. I am purchasing the pump guard to store it for the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Husker

customer_reviews.title: SIMPSON PREMIUM PRESSURE WASHER
customer_reviews.text: Machine cannot start. Fuel overflow and the Mechanic checked and confirmed the machine is faulty. Fuel coming out from exhaust and plug area
customer_reviews.author: INNOCENT IDOGHOR

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, part failed after several uses.
customer_reviews.text: I do like this pressure washer. It does shake and move around a little but not an issue for me. The handle is too low for a 6’2” individual to easily wheel around without some back bending. The only real problem I’ve had is the unloader valve stuck closed after 3 car washes. This makes the washer impossible to start without holding the trigger open while pulling the start handle. Also, the engine will not idle with the wand trigger closed. The part is simple to replace. I’ve emailed Simpson for the replacement valve and will update this review with my results of their customer service.
customer_reviews.author: 2turbos911

customer_reviews.title: Excellent until the pump fails
customer_reviews.text: The pump is starting to fail after only a couple months of use. Ive followed all priming and cleaning procedures to the letter. Hoping to replace on warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Broomhead

customer_reviews.title: Plastic pump manifold cracked
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this product because of a few reviews that I saw with this same issue. It lasted two uses before the plastic pump manifold cracked. I tried to get Simpson to send out a warranty replacement, but because it is part of the pump I have to take it in to a certified shop to have them look at it which happens to be 4 hours away. On top of all of that if the shop deems the issue not covered by the warranty I'm out $85 dollars just to have them look at it. It is funny because that is about the cost of a new pump in the first place. What a nightmare
customer_reviews.author: Brady W

product_meta.title: Simpson Cleaning MSH3125 MegaShot Gas Pressure Washer Powered by Honda GC190, 3200 PSI at 2.5 GPM, black
product_meta.description:
The SIMPSON MegaShot 3200 PSI at 2.5 GPM is ideal for use on siding, driveways, cars, RV's, paint prep and more. This is a perfect option for homeowners, because it’s lightweight, easy to maneuver and can be transported by one person. You’ll get optimum performance with minimal effort. The MSH3125 is equipped with a HONDA GC190 engine, reliable OEM axial pump, 25-ft kink & abrasion resistant hose, ergonomic spray gun and 5 stainless steel Quick-connect nozzles.

Created for the home and shop, the SIMPSON MegaShot series is perfect for the “Do-it-Yourselfer” looking for maximum performance with minimal investment. The MegaShot Series is simple to use and great for cleaning decks, patios, house siding, outdoor furniture, and prepping home exteriors for painting. Its compact design is lightweight and small enough to be easily transported by one person. The MegaShot Series is designed for optimum performance in the harshest environments, and renowned for being consistently easy to start.

2 Year limited HONDA consumer engine, 1 year limited pump, 5 year limited frame and 90 day accessory
1 Year limited pump warranty
5 Year limited frame warranty
90 Day limited accessory warranty
feature_bullets: Maintenance-free OEM Technologies axial cam pump
Welded steel construction frame.Pump/Hose Connection:Threaded M22 connection
5 Quick connect nozzle tips: 0°, 15°, 25°, 40° and soap
All pressure washers are 100% functionally tested in factory and may contain minimum residual fuel/oil or fuel odor
Note : Keep Maximum Fuel level 1/2 Inch(12.7 mm) below bottom of filler neck to avoid fuel spillage

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars3,168 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
